Browse the source code of codebrowser/source/externals/clhep/include/CLHEP/Geometry/Point3D.h

1// -*- C++ -*-
2// ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
3//
4// This file is a part of the CLHEP - a Class Library for High Energy Physics.
5//
6// History:
7// 09.09.96 E.Chernyaev - initial version
8// 12.06.01 E.Chernyaev - CLHEP-1.7: introduction of BasicVector3D to decouple
9// the functionality from CLHEP::Hep3Vector
10// 01.04.03 E.Chernyaev - CLHEP-1.9: template version
11//
12
13#ifndef HEP_POINT3D_H
14#define HEP_POINT3D_H
15
16#include <iosfwd>
17#include "CLHEP/Vector/ThreeVector.h"
18#include "CLHEP/Geometry/BasicVector3D.h"
19
20namespace HepGeom {
21
22 class Transform3D;
23
24 /**
25 * Geometrical 3D Point.
26 * This is just a declaration of the class needed to define
27 * specializations Point3D<float> and Point3D<double>.
28 *
29 * @ingroup geometry
30 * @author Evgeni Chernyaev <Evgueni.Tcherniaev@cern.ch>
31 */
32 template<class T>
33 class Point3D : public BasicVector3D<T> {};
34
35 /**
36 * Geometrical 3D Point with components of float type.
37 *
38 * @author Evgeni Chernyaev <Evgueni.Tcherniaev@cern.ch>
39 * @ingroup geometry
40 */
41 template<>
42 class Point3D<float> : public BasicVector3D<float> {
43 public:
44 /**
45 * Default constructor. */
46 Point3D() {}
47
48 /**
49 * Constructor from three numbers. */
50 Point3D(float x1, float y1, float z1) : BasicVector3D<float>(x1,y1,z1) {}
51
52 /**
53 * Constructor from array of floats. */
54 explicit Point3D(const float * a)
55 : BasicVector3D<float>(a[0],a[1],a[2]) {}
56
57 /**
58 * Copy constructor. */
59 Point3D(const Point3D<float> & v) : BasicVector3D<float>(v) {}
60
61 /**
62 * Constructor from BasicVector3D<float>. */
63 Point3D(const BasicVector3D<float> & v) : BasicVector3D<float>(v) {}
64
65 /**
66 * Destructor. */
67 ~Point3D() {}
68
69 /**
70 * Assignment. */
71 Point3D<float> & operator=(const Point3D<float> & v) {
72 set(v.x(),v.y(),v.z()); return *this;
73 }
74
75 /**
76 * Assignment from BasicVector3D<float>. */
77 Point3D<float> & operator=(const BasicVector3D<float> & v) {
78 set(v.x(),v.y(),v.z()); return *this;
79 }
80
81 /**
82 * Returns distance to the origin squared. */
83 float distance2() const { return mag2(); }
84
85 /**
86 * Returns distance to the point squared. */
87 float distance2(const Point3D<float> & p) const {
88 float dx = p.x()-x(), dy = p.y()-y(), dz = p.z()-z();
89 return dx*dx + dy*dy + dz*dz;
90 }
91
92 /**
93 * Returns distance to the origin. */
94 float distance() const { return std::sqrt(distance2()); }
95
96 /**
97 * Returns distance to the point. */
98 float distance(const Point3D<float> & p) const {
99 return std::sqrt(distance2(p));
100 }
101
102 /**
103 * Transformation by Transform3D. */
104 Point3D<float> & transform(const Transform3D & m);
105 };
106
107 /**
108 * Transformation of Point3D<float> by Transform3D.
109 * @relates Point3D
110 */
111 Point3D<float>
112 operator*(const Transform3D & m, const Point3D<float> & p);
113
114 /**
115 * Geometrical 3D Point with components of double type.
116 *
117 * @author Evgeni Chernyaev <Evgueni.Tcherniaev@cern.ch>
118 * @ingroup geometry
119 */
120 template<>
121 class Point3D<double> : public BasicVector3D<double> {
122 public:
123 /**
124 * Default constructor. */
125 Point3D() {}
126
127 /**
128 * Constructor from three numbers. */
129 Point3D(double x1, double y1, double z1) : BasicVector3D<double>(x1,y1,z1) {}
130
131 /**
132 * Constructor from array of floats. */
133 explicit Point3D(const float * a)
134 : BasicVector3D<double>(a[0],a[1],a[2]) {}
135
136 /**
137 * Constructor from array of doubles. */
138 explicit Point3D(const double * a)
139 : BasicVector3D<double>(a[0],a[1],a[2]) {}
140
141 /**
142 * Copy constructor. */
143 Point3D(const Point3D<double> & v) : BasicVector3D<double>(v) {}
144
145 /**
146 * Constructor from BasicVector3D<float>. */
147 Point3D(const BasicVector3D<float> & v) : BasicVector3D<double>(v) {}
148
149 /**
150 * Constructor from BasicVector3D<double>. */
151 Point3D(const BasicVector3D<double> & v) : BasicVector3D<double>(v) {}
152
153 /**
154 * Destructor. */
155 ~Point3D() {}
156
157 /**
158 * Constructor from CLHEP::Hep3Vector.
159 * This constructor is needed only for backward compatibility and
160 * in principle should be absent.
161 */
162 Point3D(const CLHEP::Hep3Vector & v)
163 : BasicVector3D<double>(v.x(),v.y(),v.z()) {}
164
165 /**
166 * Conversion (cast) to CLHEP::Hep3Vector.
167 * This operator is needed only for backward compatibility and
168 * in principle should not exit.
169 */
170 operator CLHEP::Hep3Vector () const { return CLHEP::Hep3Vector(x(),y(),z()); }
171
172 /**
173 * Assignment. */
174 Point3D<double> & operator=(const Point3D<double> & v) {
175 set(v.x(),v.y(),v.z()); return *this;
176 }
177
178 /**
179 * Assignment from BasicVector3D<float>. */
180 Point3D<double> & operator=(const BasicVector3D<float> & v) {
181 set(v.x(),v.y(),v.z()); return *this;
182 }
183
184 /**
185 * Assignment from BasicVector3D<double>. */
186 Point3D<double> & operator=(const BasicVector3D<double> & v) {
187 set(v.x(),v.y(),v.z()); return *this;
188 }
189
190 /**
191 * Returns distance to the origin squared. */
192 double distance2() const { return mag2(); }
193
194 /**
195 * Returns distance to the point squared. */
196 double distance2(const Point3D<double> & p) const {
197 double dx = p.x()-x(), dy = p.y()-y(), dz = p.z()-z();
198 return dx*dx + dy*dy + dz*dz;
199 }
200
201 /**
202 * Returns distance to the origin. */
203 double distance() const { return std::sqrt(distance2()); }
204
205 /**
206 * Returns distance to the point. */
207 double distance(const Point3D<double> & p) const {
208 return std::sqrt(distance2(p));
209 }
210
211 /**
212 * Transformation by Transform3D. */
213 Point3D<double> & transform(const Transform3D & m);
214 };
215
216 /**
217 * Transformation of Point3D<double> by Transform3D.
218 * @relates Point3D
219 */
220 Point3D<double>
221 operator*(const Transform3D & m, const Point3D<double> & p);
222
223} /* namespace HepGeom */
224
225#endif /* HEP_POINT3D_H */
226
